activities:
LI-COR receives employee Personal Information in connection with the management and administration of pre-employment, employment and post-employment matters.
LI-COR collects Customer Information for the purpose of supporting ordering and shipping of products; supporting service and support of products; for business-related communication; and for communication of products and services to persons.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
personaldata: The personal data transferred concern the following categories of data: - Employee and job applicants: Including but not limited to, name, employment contract and history, position, certifications, contact information, salary and commission history, separation and termination agreements, and assessment information. If references are provided, they may include name, birthdate, birthplace, company i
privacyprograms: Self-regulatory privacy program that adheres to the Safe Harbor Privacy Policies, and that includes model contract clauses with subsidiary offices in Europe, and model contract clauses with third party data processors.
recoursemech: If a complaint regarding LI-COR's use of Personal Information is raised by an EU Based Employee, LI-COR will investigate and try to resolve any dispute. If the dispute cannot be resolved, LI-COR will participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panel established by the European Data Protection Authorities (DPAs).
